metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2088 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenStack due to an inconsistency between Cinder and Nova. This issue can be triggered intentionally or by accident. A remote, authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by detaching one of their volumes from Cinder. The highest impact is to confidentiality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinder-api - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
cinder-backup - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
cinder-common - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
cinder-scheduler - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
cinder-volume - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
python3-cinder - 2:20.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The fix for this CVE was reverted in USN-6073-6 to USN-6073-9 as it was causing problems detaching volumes.  These updates may require configuration changes, see: https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/cve-2023-2088-for-charmed-openstack/37051 https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-July/034439.html  Due to the extensive changes required to fix this issue, we will not be releasing updates for Focal and earlier.
